revised_title: On the Grounds of Laplace's Method for Computing the Attractions of Spheroids
tldr: The author critiques Laplace's method for computing the attractions of spheroids, specifically focusing on the theorem laid out in the Mecanique Celeste. He argues that the demonstration is not conclusive and that the theorem is only true in certain cases, such as when the exponent of the law of attraction is positive and not less than unity.
